statuses.label: Backlog
statuses.description: Stories identified but not yet refined. Requirements may be incomplete or need clarification.

statuses.label: Ready for Dev
statuses.description: Stories with complete acceptance criteria, ready for implementation. All requirements are clear.

statuses.label: In Progress
statuses.description: Currently being implemented. Developer is actively working on the code.

statuses.label: Review
statuses.description: Code complete, awaiting review. Changes need to be verified before merging.

statuses.label: Human Review
statuses.description: Awaiting human review and approval. Complete all checklist items before moving to Done.

statuses.label: Done
statuses.description: Implemented and verified. The story is complete and ready for deployment.

statuses.label: Optional
statuses.description: Nice-to-have features that are not required for the current release.

agents.name: Mary
agents.description: Business analysis and research specialist. Handles brainstorming, market research, and documenting existing projects.
agents.whenToUse: At the start of a project to understand requirements, research competitors, or document an existing codebase.
examplePrompts: Help me brainstorm features for a task management app
Research the competitive landscape for project management tools
Document the architecture of this existing codebase

agents.name: John
agents.description: Product Manager for requirements and planning. Creates PRDs, breaks work into epics and stories, and validates alignment.
agents.whenToUse: After analysis to define product requirements, create user stories, and plan the project structure.
examplePrompts: Create a PRD for user authentication
Break this feature into epics and stories
Write acceptance criteria for the checkout flow

agents.name: Winston
agents.description: System architecture and technical design expert. Produces architecture documents and generates technical diagrams.
agents.whenToUse: After planning to design the system architecture, choose technologies, and create technical specifications.
examplePrompts: Design the database schema for user management
Create an architecture diagram for the microservices
Recommend a tech stack for this project

agents.name: Bob
agents.description: Scrum Master for sprint planning and story preparation. Generates sprint status, creates individual stories, and facilitates retrospectives.
agents.whenToUse: During sprints to plan work, track progress, prepare stories for development, and run retrospectives.
examplePrompts: Generate the current sprint status
Prepare story 2.3 for development
Run a sprint retrospective

agents.name: Amelia
agents.description: Developer for story implementation and code review. Implements stories with tests and conducts thorough code reviews.
agents.whenToUse: When stories are ready for development, or when code needs review before merging.
examplePrompts: Implement story 1.2 following the acceptance criteria
Review the code changes for the auth feature
Add unit tests for the payment module

agents.name: Barry
agents.description: Fast solo developer for small features without handoffs. Combines architectural spec with end-to-end implementation in a streamlined workflow.
agents.whenToUse: For bug fixes, small features, or quick enhancements that don't need full planning.
examplePrompts: Fix the login button not responding on mobile
Add a dark mode toggle to settings
Optimize the image loading performance

agents.name: Murat
agents.description: Test Architect for quality strategy. Initializes test frameworks, generates E2E tests, automates testing, and validates non-functional requirements.
agents.whenToUse: When setting up testing infrastructure, writing E2E tests, or validating performance requirements.
examplePrompts: Set up the E2E testing framework
Generate E2E tests for the checkout flow
Validate the performance requirements

agents.name: Sally
agents.description: User experience and UI design specialist. Creates UX deliverables from product requirements and validates specifications.
agents.whenToUse: When designing user interfaces, creating wireframes, or validating UX requirements.
examplePrompts: Design the user onboarding flow
Create wireframes for the dashboard
Review the UX of the checkout process

agents.name: Paige
agents.description: Documentation and diagrams specialist. Produces project documentation, flowcharts, and concept explanations.
agents.whenToUse: When creating documentation, explaining complex concepts, or generating diagrams.
examplePrompts: Write API documentation for the user endpoints
Create a flowchart for the order process
Explain the authentication architecture
